Title: Mapping our conservation future: scoping workshop
Meetings summary: The Mapping our conservation future: scoping workshop focused on scaling up ambition for area-based conservation. It brought together an international collection of biodiversity-related institutions to discuss three key questions: 1) How can we provide meaningful data on biodiversity at a scale needed for decision making? 2) What is needed for the biodiversity community to speak with one voice on biodiversity prioritisation - i.e. where is important to focus conservation efforts? 3)  How can we assess where important biodiversity is, and is not, being effectively managed?
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop explored options to scale-up area based conservation beyond 2020.
Link to further information: A workshop report is available on request: post-2020@unep-wcmc.org

Title: 1st meeting of the IUCN WCPA Beyond the Aichi Targets Task Force
Meetings summary: The IUCN's World Commission on Protected Areas (WCPA) meeting focused on developing an engagement and technical strategy to scale up area-based conservation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Task Force will assist Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) Parties to  build momentum for the Promise of Sydney to scale up conservation.

Title: IMPAC 4
Meetings summary: The Fourth International Marine Protected Areas Congress (IMPAC 4) brought together stakeholders to define recommendations on policy processes and to assist in establishing a global network of effectively managed Marine Protected Areas. Particular focus was placed on ocean-human relationships and the impacts of Marine Protected Areas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The conference was an opportunity to assess progress towards delivering on the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and its Aichi Biodiversity Targets on marine conservation.

Title: Half-Earth Day
Organisers: E. O. Wilson Biodiversity Foundation, National Geographic
Meetings summary: The Fourth International Marine Protected Areas Congress (IMPAC 4) brought together stakeholders to define recommendations on policy processes and to assist in establishing a global network of effectively managed Marine Protected Areas. Particular focus was placed on ocean-human relationships and the impacts of Marine Protected Areas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Half-Earth is one initiative looking at how to manage half of the planet for nature.

Title: GEO-XIV Plenary
Meetings summary: This meeting explored the use and applications of Earth observations with stakeholders from the global network of the Group on Earth Observations (GEO).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The GEO Plenary provided an opportunity to exchange knowledge, identify gaps and reduce duplication in the areas of sustainable development and environmental management.

Title: 1st Bogis-Bossey Dialogue for Transformational Change on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: The Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) convened the first of a series of dialogues, with the support of the Government of Switzerland. The goal was to identify a transformative agenda for action in sectors and domains that have an impact on or benefit from biodiversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provided the opportunity to identify how the CBD and wider biodiversity community can leverage transformational change, both in the lead up to 2020 and through the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: UNEA 3
Meetings summary: The meeting of the UN Environment Assembly (UNEA 3) brought together Member States and a variety of stakeholders to address the issue of pollution.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to consult on how linkages between pollution and biodiversity can be more effectively integrated into the future post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: WWF Towards a new CBD Strategy 2021-2030 First International Workshop
Meetings summary: This is the first in a series of meetings to discuss the vision, mission and five strategic goals of the current Strategic Plan 2011-2020. The following questions were addressed: 1. Should the vision, mission, and five strategic goals be maintained, adjusted, or amended? 2. Do we need additional goals until 2030 to better link with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)?
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Intermediate results were presented at the margins of SBSTTA-21, SBSTTA-22 and SBI-2. The discussion paper will be presented at the 14th Conference of the Parties 2018 in Egypt.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-21
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-first Meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-21) focussed on information concerning biodiversity-related scenarios and related scientific and technical information on trends and projections towards 2050 and possible pathways to achieve the 2050 Vision.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting presented the opportunity to provide policy relevant syntheses of future pathways for biodiversity and ecosystem services.

Title: International Water Summit 2018
Meetings summary: The Summit brought together stakeholders to develop new strategies on sustainable water use and technologies.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Summit provided an opportunity to engage with the water sector on how linkages between water and biodiversity can be more effectively integrated into the future post-2020 biodiversity framework

Title: Technical Expert Workshop on Other Effective Area-Based Conservation Measures for Achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11
Meetings summary: This workshop aimed to provide scientific and technical advice on definition, management approaches, and identification of other effective area-based conservation measures in the terrestrial realm, as well as their role in achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Future targets are likely to consider other effective area-based conservation measures in terrestrial and marine realms.

Title: Expert Workshop on Marine Protected Areas and Other Effective Area-based Conservation Measures for Achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11 in Marine and Coastal Areas
Meetings summary: This workshop aimed to provide scientific and technical advice on definition, management approaches, and identification of other effective area-based conservation measures in the marine realm, as well as their role in achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Future targets are likely to consider other effective area-based conservation measures in terrestrial and marine realms.

Title: 9th Session of the World Urban Forum
Meetings summary: The Ninth Session of the World Urban Forum (WUF9) focuses on the New Urban Agenda, as agreed at Habitat III, as an approach to achieve Agenda 2030 and the Sustainable Development Goals.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This represents an opportunity to engage in discussions on the linkages between cities and biodiversity

Title: Deadline for comments on the draft document: 'proposals for a comprehensive and participatory process for the preparation of the post-2020 biodiversity framework'
Meetings summary: A draft document on 'proposals for a comprehensive and participatory process for the preparation of the post-2020 biodiversity framework' has been made available for peer review. The deadline for comments, as well as any other relevant input, is 16 February 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The present note has been prepared by the Executive Secretary to provide the Subsidiary Body on Implementation with proposals concerning the process for the development of a follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. It draws on the submissions received in response to a notification issued inviting Parties, other Governments, relevant organisations and indigenous peoples and local communities to provide comments and inputs on the process for developing the post 2020 global biodiversity framework. It also draws on experiences in developing the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 in the lead-up to the tenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties.

Title: Symposium on Safeguarding space for nature, securing our future: developing a post-2020 strategy
Organisers: ZSL, NGS, UNEP-WCMC, IUCN, BirdLife International
Meetings summary:
The meeting will focus on:
(1) reviewing the science informing future area-based conservation targets 
(2) evaluating the implications of various policy options 
(3) provide balanced, evidence-based recommendations to Parties to the CBD and other policy processes and 
(4) raise awareness of the need for a more ambitious, holistic and effective strategy on space for nature, incorporating protected areas and other effective area-based conservation measures.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will be used to prepare an information document to inform discussion on the post-2020 global biodiversity framework at COP14, and if possible at the preparatory meetings in 2018.

Title: UN World Wildlife Day 2018
Meetings summary: UN World Wildlife Day celebrates and raises awareness of the world's wild animals and plants. The theme for World Wildlife Day 2018 is "Big Cats".
Relevance to the post-2020 process: World Wildlife Day aims to raise awareness of biodiversity which relates to Aichi Biodiversity Target 12 of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020.

Title: World Ocean Summit 2018
Meetings summary: The World Ocean Summit brings together business, government and civil society to consider how the ocean is used.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Summit presents an opportunity for stakeholders, in particular the private sector, to scale up ambitions for the sustainable use of the oceans.

Title: IPBES-6 Plenary
Meetings summary: The sixth meeting of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES-6) will discuss implementation of the work programme 2014-2018, deliverables and assessments.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Plenary provides an opportunity to discuss how regional and sub-regional assessments can be used in planning and delivering of the post-2020 biodiversity agenda.

Title: 8th World Water Forum
Meetings summary: The World Water Forum brings together individuals and organisations interested in the theme of water, the nine forum themes and the 17 Sustainable Development Goals.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provides the opportunity to enhance linkages between water and biodiversity

Title: 2nd Bogis-Bossey Dialogue for Transformational Change on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: This is the second in a series of dialogues, convened by the Secretariat of the CBD with the support of the Government of Switzerland. This meeting brings Parties together to discuss the outcomes of the first dialogue and identify a transformative agenda for action.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to contribute to discussions on an ambitious, innovative, yet pragmatic post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: CCI Expert Workshop: Framing the Future for Biodiversity
Organisers: UNEP-WCMC, BirdLife International, RSPB, Cambridge University, IUCN, ZSL, Defra
Meetings summary: The Cambridge Conservation Initiative (CCI) is convening a workshop that will bring together key players involved in different aspects of developing and implementing plans and strategies for the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity, and reviewing their implementation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provides the opportunity to examine the evidence base required to underpin the development of the new biodiversity framework .

Title: CCI Workshop: Communicating the Future for Biodiversity
Organisers: UNEP-WCMC, BirdLife International, RSPB, Cambridge University, IUCN, ZSL, Defra, CBD
Meetings summary: Following the workshop on Framing the Future for Biodiversity, this meeting will bring together communication experts to exchange and coordinate information on existing ongoing communication activities and will explore the most effective mechanisms to ensure coherent messages and activities in the lead up to 2020.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provides the opportunity to develop coherent messages and activities in the lead up to 2020.

Title: World Conference on Marine Biodiversity 2018
Meetings summary: The 4th World Conference on Marine Biodiversity will bring together scientists, practitioners, and policy makers to discuss and advance our understanding of the importance and current state of biodiversity in the marine environment.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This conference provides opportunities to discuss strategies for conservation of marine biodiversity in the context of the current Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2018
Meetings summary: This is a day to increase an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues.  The theme for this year is to celebrate 25 years of action for biodiversity.

Title: World Environment Day 2018
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. It is celebrated in over 100 countries. The theme this year is plastic pollution.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public pressure for the upcoming CBD 14th meeting of the Conference of the Parties (COP14).

Title: 5th European Congress of Conservation Biology
Meetings summary: The theme of the Fifth European Congress of Conservation Biology (ECCB2018-5) is planetary wellbeing – a concept that captures the wellbeing of people as well as the integrity and sustainability of Earth's ecosystems.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: ECCB2018-5 provides a forum to discuss and develop solutions for some of the key challenges faced by humanity by bringing together natural and social scientists, practitioners, industry members and government decision-makers.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-22
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-22) will focus on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress.

Title: 4th Blue Planet Symposium
Meetings summary: The 4th Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Blue Planet Symposium will serve as a forum for discussion of ocean and coastal information needs for sustainable development, Blue Growth and societal awareness. The symposium will bring together producers of ocean and coastal information and current and potential users of ocean and coastal information.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This event aims to bridge the gap between data and services, to deliver usable information that supports informed decision-making and address policy mandates toward reaching sustainable development.

Title: CBD SBI-2
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Implementation (SBI-2) will focus on progress in the implementation preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of implementation of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and synergies with other conventions.

Title: Committee on Fisheries (COFI 33)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on Fisheries (COFI) presently constitutes a global inter-governmental forum where major international fisheries and aquaculture problems and issues are examined and recommendations addressed to governments, regional fishery bodies, NGOs, fish workers, FAO and the international community, periodically on a world-wide basis.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The provisional agenda covers biodiversity, including biodiversity mainstreaming in the work of FAO concerning fisheries and aquaculture.

Title: High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development 2018
Meetings summary: The theme of the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development (HLPF) 2018 will be: "Transformation towards sustainable and resilient societies". The sub-set of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to be reviewed in depth will be: SDG 6, 7, 11, 12, 15 and 17.  In addition, 48 countries are expected to present their Voluntary National Reviews (VNRs).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The HLPF has a central role in the follow-up and review of the 2030 SDGs at the global level. The forum provides an opportunity to demonstrate how biodiversity underpins all of the 17 SDGs.

Title: Committee on Forests (COFO 24)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on Forestry (COFO) brings together heads of forest services and other senior government officials to identify emerging policy and technical issues, to seek solutions and to advise FAO and others on appropriate action.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Committee provides the opportunity to discuss linkages between biodiversity and forestry-related issues

Title: UNGA 73
Meetings summary: 73rd Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 73) will bring together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Member states are likely to make commitments on biodiversity that may be relevant to the development of the post-2020 biodiversity process.

Title: 2018 G20 – Buenos Aires summit
Meetings summary: The Group of Twenty (G20) is a forum for international cooperation on financial and economic issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Decisions taken by the G20 aim to bring about reform at both the national and international level. This summit also provides the opportunity to discuss linkages between biodiversity and economic and financial issues.

Title: Committee on Agriculture (COAG-26)
Meetings summary: The Committee on Agriculture (COAG) is one of the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO)’s Governing Bodies which aims to provide policy and regulatory guidance on issues relating to agriculture, livestock, food safety, nutrition, rural development and natural resource management.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting could provide an opportunity to consider pathways to sustainable food and agriculture that do not compromise biodiversity.

Title: Committee on World Food Security (CFS-46)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on World Food Security (CFS) is an international and intergovernmental platform for stakeholders to work together to address food security and nutrition-related issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting could provide an opportunity to enhance coordination among different sectors and establish linkages between biodiversity and food security.

Title: Ramsar COP13
Meetings summary: At the 13th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands (Ramsar COP13), representatives of the governments of each of the Contracting Parties will meet to discuss, among other things the conservation and wise use of wetlands.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meetings could provide the opportunity to enhance synergies between the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands and the CBD.

Title: GEO-XV Plenary
Meetings summary: The Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Plenary is the highest decision-making body of GEO.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The GEO Plenary provided an opportunity to exchange knowledge, identify gaps and reduce duplication in the areas of sustainable development and environmental management.

Title: CBD COP14
Meetings summary: The 14th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD COP14) will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This will include a review of the Convention's progress and implementation, the mainstreaming of biodiversity into key sectors and progress towards developing a post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected that Parties will agree on a process for developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework. The agenda will also include an assessment of the Convention's implementation of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and progress towards achieving the Aichi Biodiversity targets.

Title: Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety COPMOP9
Meetings summary: The 9th Meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the Meeting of the Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (COPMOP9) is to review the implementation of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety and will contribute to decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing COPMOP3
Meetings summary: The 3rd Meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing (COPMOP3) is to review the implementation of the Nagoya Protocol and make decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: UN World Wildlife Day 2019
Meetings summary: UN World Wildlife Day celebrates and raises awareness of the world's wild animals and plants.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: World Wildlife Day aims to raise awareness of biodiversity which relates to Aichi Biodiversity Target 12 of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020.

Title: UNEA 4
Meetings summary: The meeting of the UN Environment Assembly (UNEA) will bring together Member States and key stakeholders. Proposed themes are "food and nature" and "sustainable consumption and production". These will be finalised at the end of February.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The UNEA constituency is the same as that of the CBD intergovernmental process - the Environment Ministers of the world.

Title: UNGA 74
Meetings summary: The 74th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 74) will bring together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to raise the political profile of the post-2020 process.

Title: UNFCCC COP24
Meetings summary: The twenty-fourth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC COP24) will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This will include a review of progress towards the Paris Climate Change Agreement, updates on guidelines for its implementation and transitions in key sectors that will be needed for the Paris Agreemenet to be met.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Paris agreement can be mutually supportive.

Title: CBD's Regional Consultation workshops
Meetings summary: It is anticipated that 10 regional consultation workshops (2 per region) will be held. These workshops would be open to Parties, other governments, indigenous peoples and local communities, relevant organisations and stakeholders from the relevant regions.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is a key activity organised by the CBD that is likely to feed into discussions leading to the  post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: IPBES-7 Plenary
Meetings summary: The Plenary of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES) seventh session will focus on the completion of the IPBES Global Assessment and the anticipated approval of the second programme work.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Findings of the IPBES Global Assessment and future work programme will help to inform the development and implementation of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2019
Meetings summary: This is a day to increase an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues.  The theme for this year is to celebrate 25 years of action for biodiversity.

Title: World Environment Day 2019
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. It is celebrated in over 100 countries.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public pressure for the upcoming CBD COP14.

Title: CITES COP18
Meetings summary: The eighteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES COP18) is expected to address a range of issues ranging from implementation of the Convention and species-specific matters to trade controls and the listing of new species in the Appendices to the CITES.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Resolutions, decisions and intentions coming out of the meeting will likely form an important component of how national and international strategies on wildlife trade are shaped over the coming years, thus representing relevant input to the post-2020 biodiversity agenda.

Title: High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development 2019
Meetings summary: The theme of the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development (HLPF) 2019 will be: “Empowering people and ensuring inclusiveness and equality”. The sub-set of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to be reviewed in depth by HLPF 2019 will be: SDG 4, 8, 10, 13, 16 and 17.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The HLPF has a central role in the follow-up and review of the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at the global level. The forum provides an opportunity to demonstrate how biodiversity underpins all of the 17 SDGs.

Title: IUCN Regional Conservation Forums
Meetings summary: Regional Conservation Forums (RCFs) will be held as part of the preparatory work towards the IUCN World Conservation Congress. At the RCFs IUCN Members' discussions include preparations towards the Congress including matters pertaining to the work Programme of IUCN for the next quadrennium and the potential policy motions to be submitted to the Congress for approval.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected that discussions during the 2019 RCFs will also help to inform IUCN’s position regarding the post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: OceanObs'19: An Ocean of opportunity
Meetings summary: As part of the decadal conference series, the OceanObs’19 conference will bring together ocean observing communities, aiming to improve coordination of regional and national efforts to better observe the global ocean, to better respond to the joint scientific and societal needs of a fit-for-purpose ocean observing system, and maximise the overall benefit of more integrated observing.​ A set of Community Whitepapers will be published in a peer reviewed journal.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This conference is likely to provide recommendations on the use of global ocean observation data.

Title: Trondheim Conference on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: The Trondheim Conferences are a result of collaboration between the Secretariat of the UN Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD), United Nations Environment and the Norwegian government and are held every 3-4 years. The Trondheim Conferences provide an opportunity for consultation on scientific views and issues of relevance to CBD.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Trondheim Conference for Biodiversity could be used to convene the CBD's first global consultation workshop. This would focus on scientific issues related to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: CBD's Global science consultation workshop
Meetings summary: It is assumed that the second global consultation workshop would focus on scientific issues related to the post 2020 global biodiversity framework and that an event such as the Trondheim Biodiversity Conference could be used to convene the consultation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is a key activity organised by the CBD, leading to the consideration of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: UNCCD COP14
Meetings summary: The fourteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD COP 14) will assess progress and implementation of the commitments to achieve Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the UNCCD 2018-2030 Strategic Framework can be mutually supportive.

Title: UNFCCC COP25
Meetings summary: The twenty-fifth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC COP25) will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This will include a review of progress towards the Paris Climate Change Agreement, updates on guidelines for its implementation and transitions in key sectors that will be needed for the Paris Agreemenet to be met.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Paris agreement can be mutually supportive.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-23
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-third meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-23) will focus on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in 2020.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress.

Title: WG8J-11
Meetings summary: The 11th meeting of the Ad Hoc Open-ended Working Group on Article 8(j) and Related Provisions of the Convention on Biological Diversity (WG8J-11) will examine the potential role of traditional knowledge, customary sustainable use and the contribution of the collective actions of indigenous peoples and local communities in the conservation of biological diversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to engage and involve indigenous and local communities in discussions related to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: CBD's Global policy consultation workshop
Meetings summary: It is assumed that the second global consultation workshop will focus on issues related to policy and would have approximately 100 participants representing Parties, other governments, indigenous peoples and local communities, relevant organisations and stakeholders from all regions.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is a key activity organised by the CBD, leading to the consideration of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-24
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-fourth meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-24) will focus on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in 2020.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress. The draft of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be considered, with a view to providing advice on targets to SBI-3.

Title: CBD SBI-3
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Implementation (SBI-2) will focus on progress in the implementation preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be considered, with a view to developing a recommendation for COP-15.

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2020
Meetings summary: This is a day to increase an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues.  The theme for this year is to celebrate 25 years of action for biodiversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This day is relevant to raising awareness and building momentum in the lead up to COP-15.

Title: World Environment Day 2020
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. It is celebrated in over 100 countries.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public awareness of nature, a key aspect in the lead up to COP-15.

Title: IUCN World Conservation Congress
Meetings summary: The IUCN World Conservation Congress brings together several thousand leaders and decision-makers from government, civil society, indigenous peoples, business, and academia, with the goal of conserving the environment and harnessing the solutions nature offers to global challenges. The Congress aims to improve how we manage our natural environment for human, social and economic development.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The IUCN World Conservation Congresses produce a number of outcomes that set the direction for the Union for the next four years. It is expected that the different outcomes from Congress will provide recommendations for the CBD's COP15, and aim to support the wider implementation of the Convention, its objectives, and the international sustainable development agenda.

Title: UNGA 75
Meetings summary: The 75th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 75) will bring together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to raise the political profile of the post-2020 process.

Title: CBD COP15
Meetings summary: The fifteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties (COP15) to the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) will review the achievement and delivery of the CBD's Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Furthermore, decision on the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be made, together with decisions on related topics including capacity building and resource mobilisation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the final decision of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be taken at this meeting.

Title: Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety COPMOP10
Meetings summary: The tenth Meeting of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (COPMOP10) will review the implementation of the Cartagena Protocol and makes decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing COPMOP4
Meetings summary: The fourth meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing (COPMOP4) will review the implementation of the Nagoya Protocol and makes decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.
